column3: Type:Eight-core, Intel[tm] Xeon E5-2600 series processors. Model/Speed/Watts: E5-2658, 2.1 GHz, 95W
column12: Two 10/100/1000Base-T Gigabit Ethernet ports interfaces, one interface to each Network Express Module slot.
column37: Level 1: 32 KB instruction and 32 KB data L1 cache per core. Level 2: 256 KB shared instruction/data L2 cache per core. Level 3: Up to 20 MB shared inclusive L3 cache per processor.
column39: Total DIMM slots: 24. DIMM type: DDR3 1066MHz DIMMs DIMM sizes: 8 GB and 16 GB. Maximum capacity: 384 GB when configured with 16-GB DIMMs.
column80: One dedicated 10/100Base-T Ethernet port to the CMM.
column97: 2D graphics controller with 8 MB video memory embedded inside service processor. Supports resolutions up to 1,600 x 1,200 x 16 bits at60 Hz 1,024 x 768 when viewed remotely via Oracle ILOM RKVMS.
column163: Note: Modular System chassis specifications are documented on the chassis specification page. Reference the Sun Netra 6000 Modular System section of the Handbooks Systems List to find documentation on the chassis.
column164: Up to four optional, hot swappable, Small Form Factor SFF 2.5 drive bays per Server Module. Four SAS-2 interfaces to the midplane, two to each Network Express Module slot. Note: RAID Expansion Module is required for SAS support. Drive Type Density Speed Form Factor SAS 300 GB 10,000 RPM 2.5 SAS 600 GB 10,000 RPM 2.5 Drive Type Density Speed Form Factor SAS 300 GB 10,000 RPM 2.5 SAS 600 GB 10,000 RPM 2.5
column165: Oracle Integrated Lights Out Manager Oracle ILOM provides: Remote Keyboard, Video, Mouse redirection. Full remote management through command-line, IPMI, and browser interfaces. Remote media capability DVD, CD, ISO image, floppy. Advanced power management and monitoring. Active Directory, LDAP, RADIUS support.
column166: Dedicated 10/100 Base-T Ethernet network management port. In-band, out-of-band and sideband network management access via any one of the four main ports of the server or the dedicated port. RJ-45 serial management port.
column167: Comprehensive fault detection and notification. In-band, out-of-band, and side-band SNMP monitoring V1, V2c, V3. Syslog and SMTP alerts, WS-MAN. Automatically create a service request for key hardware faults with Oracle Automated Service Request ASR.
column168: The Dongle Cable assembly connects to the UCP and provides the following: Connection to ILOM SP. Dual USB 2.0 ports. VGA video connection to an on-board AST2100 graphics chip.
column169: I/O is offered in two form factors: PCI Express ExpressModules EM and PCI Express Network Express Module. Each Netra Blade X3-2B / Sun Netra X6270 M3 has four, PCI Express Gen 2 links allocated to: Two EMs and Two NEMs

column202: The SP card is installed with Integrated Lights-Out Manager ILOM software. ILOM can be accessed via the RJ45 serial port provided by the Dongle cable assembly connected to the Universal Connector Port UCP on the front of the Netra SPARC T3 1B Server. ILOM can also be accessed through the CMM of the Netra 6000. The Dongle cable assembly is provided with the Sun Blade 6000 chassis and also orderable. Built-in Integrated Lights Out Manager ILOM service processor delivers: Direct manageability same as Oracle rack-mounted Netra SPARC T3 servers. Full monitoring of blade by SNMP. Graphical user interface GUI and comprehensive command-line interface CLI. Full-featured virtual console through remote KVMS feature. Optional Oracle Enterprise Manager, an advanced hardware management enabling discovery, grouping, bare metal provisioning, hardware and OS monitoring, and integrated LDoms management.

column202: The SP card is installed with Integrated Lights-Out Manager ILOM software. ILOM can be accessed via the RJ45 serial port provided by the Dongle cable assembly connected to the Universal Connector Port UCP on the front of the Netra SPARC T4 1B Server. ILOM can also be accessed through the Chassis Monitoring Module CMM of the Netra 6000. The Dongle cable assembly is provided with the Sun Blade 6000 chassis and also orderable. Built-in Integrated Lights Out Manager ILOM service processor delivers: Direct manageability same as Oracle rack-mounted Netra SPARC T4 servers. Full monitoring of blade by SNMP. Graphical user interface GUI and comprehensive command-line interface CLI. Full-featured virtual console through remote KVMS feature. Optional Oracle Enterprise Manager, an advanced hardware management enabling discovery, grouping, bare metal provisioning, hardware and OS monitoring, and integrated LDoms management.

column200: Patch Readmes and Downloads Boot PROM and LOM Revisions
column202: The SP card is installed with Integrated Lights-Out Manager ILOM software. ILOM can be accessed via the RJ45 serial port provided by the Dongle cable assembly connected to the Universal Connector Port UCP on the front of the Netra SPARC T5-1B Server. ILOM can also be accessed through the Chassis Monitoring Module CMM of the Netra 6000. The Dongle cable assembly is provided with the Sun Netra 6000 chassis and also orderable. Built-in Integrated Lights Out Manager ILOM service processor delivers: Full monitoring of blade by SNMP. Graphical user interface GUI and comprehensive command-line interface CLI. Full-featured virtual console through remote Keyboard, Video, Mouse and Storage RKVMS feature.
column204: Four x8 PCIe busses: Two dedicated to NEMs, two dedicated to EMs. Four SAS-2 interfaces, two per NEM. Two 10/100/1000 GbE interfaces, one per NEM. 10/100 Ethernet management port to CMM. Cards that are categorized as PCIe 3.0 are qualified to run with the T5-1B, however due to midplane restriction, will only run at 2.0 speeds. Between switch and CPU, the Blade runs at PCIe 3.0. However due to the midplane connector capabilities, from switch to the EM/NEM the speed is limited to PCIe 2.0.

column79: Two 10/100/1000 Base-T Ethernet ports using the Intel 82571ED GbE transceiver. One dedicated 10/100 Base-T Ethernet port for the management network which can be optionally shared with the main network ports if desired. Two optional 10GB XAUI Ethernet ports through the addition of either a passthrough fabric expansion module or dual channel 10 GbE fabric expansion module.
column164: Up to four optional, internal SAS drives per blade. Drive Type Density Speed Form Factor RAID SAS 300 GB 10,000 RPM 2.5 RAID 0 or 1 Drive Type Density Speed Form Factor RAID SAS 300 GB 10,000 RPM 2.5 RAID 0 or 1
column168: Exposed via dongle cable: One RJ-45 serial console to server module ILOM. Three USB 2.0 ports 2 external via dongle and 1 internal accepting USB drive. One VGA port.
column200: Patch Readmes and Downloads Boot PROM and LOM Revisions
column202: The SP card is installed with Integrated Lights-Out Manager ILOM software. ILOM can be accessed via the RJ45 serial port provided by the Dongle cable assembly connected to the Universal Connector Port UCP on the front of the SPARC T3 1B Server Module. The Dongle cable assembly is provided with the Sun Blade 6000 chassis and also orderable. Built-in Integrated Lights Out Manager ILOM service processor delivers: Direct manageability same as Oracle rack-mounted SPARC T3 servers. Full monitoring of blade by SNMP. Graphical user interface GUI and comprehensive command-line interface CLI. Full-featured virtual console through remote KVMS feature. Optional Oracle Enterprise Manager, an advanced hardware management enabling discovery, grouping, bare metal provisioning, hardware and OS monitoring, and integrated LDoms management.

column311: Sun Blade 6000 chassis-level management is provided by the Chassis Monitoring Modules CMM Integrated Lights-Out Management ILOM software. ILOM provides basic information for disk blades or SES-NEMs. The ILOM GUI recognizes the presences of SAS-NEMs and disk blades. Only the ILOM command-line interface CLI is available for use with disk and SAS-NEM modules proxy program. The Sun Blade 6000 Disk Module supports enclosure management features accessible from a management client that supports SES-2 SCSI Enclosure Services. The Sun Blade 6000 Disk Module expanders are SES-2 compliant. These enclosure management features are available through the management software called the Sun Common Array Manager CAM. Support for the Sun Blade Disk Module and SAS-NEMs is available beginning with CAM version 6.1.2. CAM offers these capabilities and more: Event and fault monitoring E-mail alert notification FRU identification and status Enclosure reset Enclosure firmware upgrade Fault isolation Service Advisor wizard for problem resolution Sun Auto Service Request ASR uses fault telemetry 24/7 to automatically initiate a service request and begin the problem resolution process as soon as a problem occurs

column339: I/O is offered in two form factors: PCI Express ExpressModules EM and PCI Express Network Express Modules NEM. Each Sun Blade T6300 has four, x8 lane PCI Express links allocated to: Two EMsand Two NEMs. Each NEM has one link assigned to each server module. All server modules share the NEM. For example, Blade 0 has access to NEM 0/slot 0, and NEM 1/slot 0. Blade 1 to NEM 0/slot 1 and NEM 1/slot 1, etc. EM slots are not shared between server modules. Each EM slot is specific to one server module.

column331: The SP card is installed with Integrated Lights-Out Manager ILOM software. ILOM can be accessed via a Dongle cable assembly connection to the Universal Connector Port UCP on the front of the Sun Blade T6320. There are 2 different Dongle cables. A three connector and a four connector. To connect to ILOM using the four connector dongle cable, use the DB-9 serial connector. To connect to ILOM using the three connector dongle cable, use the RJ-45 serial connector. The Dongle cable assembly is provided with the Sun Blade 6000 and Sun Blade 6048 chassis. Support for Sun Management Center with add-on software. Compatibility for third-party SNMP system managers with requirements for SNMP v1, v2C, v3. Graphical user interface and comprehensive command line interface CLI to emulate Advanced Lights Out ALOM.

column339: I/O is offered in two form factors: PCI Express ExpressModules EM and PCI Express Network Express Modules NEM. Each Sun Blade X6220 has four, x8 lane PCI Express links allocated to: Two EMsand Two NEMs. Each NEM has one link assigned to each server module. All server modules share the NEM. For example, Blade 0 has access to NEM 0/slot 0, and NEM 1/slot 0. Blade 1 to NEM 0/slot 1 and NEM 1/slot 1, etc. EM slots are not shared between server modules. column331: The SP is not a separate card. It is embedded on the motherboard. The SP may be installed with Lights-Out Manager LOM, IPMI 2.0-compatible software. The factory pre-configured LOM transitioned from ELOM to ILOM in September 2008. The SP card provides one 10/100 Management Ethernet Port to Midplane and the Chassis Monitoring Module CMM. LOM on the SP card can be accessed via the Dongle cable assemblys DB9 connector to the Universal Connector Port UCP on the front of the Sun Blade X6250. The Dongle cable assembly is provided with the Sun Blade 6000 chassis and also orderable. Option X4621A. The SP card and LOM provide the following: A Browser User Interface HTTP/HTTPS. DMTF/CLP based CLI and SSH. Support for RADIUS, LDAP, and MS Active Directory. IPMI 2.0 Host access through KCS and remote. Compatibility for third-party SNMP system managers with requirements for SNMP v1, v2C, v3. Remote KVMS/Java Console redirected Keyboard Video Mouse and Storage through a JAVA Application. Support for Sun N1 System Manager.
column338: The Dongle Cable Assembly Option X4621A that ships with the Sun Blade 6000 chassis connects to the UCP and provides the following: VGA HD15 port to AST2000 video controller with 128MB of shared SDRAM. 2 USB 2.0 ports. DB9 serial port for connection to SP LOM. RJ45 port. Not supported on the Sun Blade X6220 or X6250. DB9F to RJ45F DCE Adapter.
column339: I/O is offered in two form factors: PCI Express ExpressModules EM and PCI Express Network Express Modules NEM. Each Sun Blade X6250 has four, PCI Express links allocated to: Two EMs X8and Two NEMs X4. Each NEM has one link assigned to each server module. All server modules share the NEM. For example, Blade 0 has access to NEM 0/slot 0, and NEM 1/slot 0. Blade 1 to NEM 0/slot 1 and NEM 1/slot 1, etc. EM slots are not shared between server modules. Each EM slot is specific to one server module.

column164: Up to four optional, hot swappable, hot pluggable, SAS, SATA, or SATA SSD drives per blade. Drive Type Density Speed Form Factor SAS 146.8 GB 10,000 RPM 2.5 SAS 300 GB 10,000 RPM 2.5 SATA 500 GB 5,400 RPM 2.5 Configuration rules are: SAS HDD, SATA HDD, SATA SSD can be mixed and matched, REM is required. Only SATA HDD, SATA SSD can be mixed and matched without a REM, REM is optional. If a SAS HDD is selected then a REM controller is required. Auto add HDD filler panel part number 6331-N based on empty HDD slots. SATA HDDs requires a quantity of 1 cable part number 4859A to be auto added when a REM is not selected. SATA HDDs requires a quantity of 1 cable part number 4860A to be auto added with a REM. SAS HDDs requires a quantity of 1 cable part number 4860A to be auto added with a REM.When SATA and SAS HDDs are mixed a quantity of 1 cable part number 4860A is required to be auto added with a REM. REMs - A REM is optional, but see Notes 1 an 3 above. Cannot mix SAS and SATA in the same volume. Drive Type Density Speed Form Factor SAS 146.8 GB 10,000 RPM 2.5 SAS 300 GB 10,000 RPM 2.5 SATA 500 GB 5,400 RPM 2.5

column331: The SP is not a separate card. It is embedded on the motherboard. The SP is installed with Integrated Lights-Out Manager ILOM 3.0. The SP provides one 10/100 Management Ethernet Port to Midplane and the Chassis Monitoring Module CMM. ILOM on the SP card can be accessed via the Dongle cable assembly. The three-cable X4622A dongle cable option can be used to connect to ILOM using the Universal Connector Port UCP on the front of the Sun Blade X6270 M2. Use the RJ-45 serial connector on the 3-cable dongle to connect to ILOM via the UCP. The SP card and LOM provide the following: Remote management with full Keyboard, Mouse, Video, Storage KVMS redirection. Remove media capability floppy, DVD, CD etc.. DMTF style CLI. Browser-based UI for control of the system through a graphical interface. IPMI 2.0 compliance for management and control. SNMP V1, V2c, V3 for system monitoring. Monitor and report system and component status on all FRUs.
column338: The Dongle Cable assembly connects to the UCP and provides the following: Connection to ILOM SP. 2 USB 2.0 ports. VGA video connection to an on-board AST2100 graphics chip.
column339: I/O is offered in two form factors: PCI Express ExpressModules EM and PCI Express Network Express Modules NEM. Each Sun Blade X6270 M2 has four, PCI Express Gen 2 links allocated to: Two EMs X8and Two NEMs X8. Each NEM has one link assigned to each server module. All server modules share the NEM. For example, Blade 0 has access to NEM 0/slot 0, and NEM 1/slot 0. Blade 1 to NEM 0/slot 1 and NEM 1/slot 1, etc. EM slots are not shared between server modules. Each EM slot is specific to one server module.

Drive Type Density Speed Form Factor RAID SAS 500 GB 7,500 RPM 2.5 Hardware RAID requires REM SAS 300 GB 10,000 RPM 2.5 Hardware RAID requires REM SAS 146 GB 10,000 RPM 2.5 Hardware RAID requires REM SAS 73 GB 15,000 RPM 2.5 Hardware RAID requires REM SAS 73 GB 10,000 RPM 2.5 Hardware RAID requires REM Configuration rules are: SAS HDD, SATA HDD, SATA SSD can be mixed and matched, REM is required. Only SATA HDD, SATA SSD can be mixed and matched without a REM, REM is optional. If a SAS HDD is selected then a REM controller is required. Auto add HDD filler panel part number 6331-N based on empty HDD slots. SATA HDDs requires a quantity of 1 cable part number 4859A to be auto added when a REM is not selected. SATA HDDs requires a quantity of 1 cable part number 4860A to be auto added with a REM. SAS HDDs requires a quantity of 1 cable part number 4860A to be auto added with a REM. When SATA and SAS HDDs are mixed a quantity of 1 cable part number 4860A is required to be auto added with a REM. REMs - A REM is optional, but see Notes 1 an 3 above. Cannot mix SAS and SATA in the same volume. column331: The SP is not a separate card. It is embedded on the motherboard. The SP is installed with Integrated Lights-Out Manager ILOM. The SP provides one 10/100 Management Ethernet Port to Midplane and the Chassis Monitoring Module CMM. ILOM on the SP card can be accessed via the Dongle cable assembly. Both the three-cable X4622A and four-cable X4621A dongle cable options can be used to connect to ILOM using the Universal Connector Port UCP on the front of the Sun Blade X6270. Use the DB-9 serial connector with the DB9F to RJ45F adapter on the 4-cable dongle to connect to ILOM via the UCP. Use the RJ-45 serial connector on the 3-cable dongle to connect to ILOM via the UCP. The SP card and LOM provide the following: Remote management with full Keyboard, Mouse, Video, Storage KVMS redirection. Remove media capability floppy, DVD, CD etc.. DMTF style CLI. Browser-based UI for control of the system through a graphical interface. IPMI 2.0 compliance for management and control. SNMP V1, V2c, V3 for system monitoring. Monitor and report system and component status on all FRUs.
column338: The Dongle Cable assembly connects to the UCP and provides the following: Connection to ILOM SP. 2 USB 2.0 ports. VGA video connection to an on-board AST2100 graphics chip.
column339: I/O is offered in two form factors: PCI Express ExpressModules EM and PCI Express Network Express Modules NEM. Each Sun Blade X6270 has four, PCI Express Gen 2 links allocated to: Two EMs X8and Two NEMs X4. Each NEM has one link assigned to each server module. All server modules share the NEM. For example, Blade 0 has access to NEM 0/slot 0, and NEM 1/slot 0. Blade 1 to NEM 0/slot 1 and NEM 1/slot 1, etc. EM slots are not shared between server modules. Each EM slot is specific to one server module.
column342: One on-board 16 GB Compact Flash option.

column331: The SP is not a separate card. It is embedded on the motherboard. The SP is installed with Lights-Out Manager LOM, IPMI 2.0-compatible software. Embedded Lights-Out Manager ELOM and Integrated Lights-Out Manager ILOM are supported. The factory pre-configured LOM transitioned to ILOM in September 2008. The SP card provides one 10/100 Management Ethernet Port to Midplane and the Chassis Monitoring Module CMM. The DB9-to-RJ45 serial adapter cable provides DB9 serial access to the server module through an RJ45 connection. LOM on the SP card can be accessed via the Dongle cables DB9 connector to the Universal Connector Port UCP RJ45 connector on the front of the Sun Blade X6450. The Dongle cable assembly is provided with the Sun Blade 6000 chassis and also orderable. Option X4621A. The SP card and LOM provide the following: A Browser User Interface HTTP/HTTPS. DMTF/CLP based CLI and SSH. Support for RADIUS, LDAP, and MS Active Directory. IPMI 2.0 Host access through KCS and remote. Compatibility for third-party SNMP system managers with requirements for SNMP v1, v2C, v3. Remote KVMS/Java Console redirected Keyboard Video Mouse and Storage through a JAVA Application. Support for Sun N1 System Manager.
column338: The Dongle Cable Assembly Option X4621A that ships with the Sun Blade 6000 chassis connects to the UCP and provides the following: VGA HD15 port to AST2000 video controller with 128MB of shared SDRAM. 2 USB 2.0 ports. DB9 serial port for connection to SP LOM. RJ45 port. DB9F to RJ45F DCE Adapter.
column339: I/O is offered in two form factors: PCI Express ExpressModules EM and PCI Express Network Express Modules NEM. Each Sun Blade X6450 has four, PCI Express links allocated to: Two EMs X8and Two NEMs X4. Each NEM has one link assigned to each server module. All server modules share the NEM. For example, Blade 0 has access to NEM 0/slot 0, and NEM 1/slot 0. Blade 1 to NEM 0/slot 1 and NEM 1/slot 1, etc. EM slots are not shared between server modules. Each EM slot is specific to one server module.
column345: 8GB Compact Flash Type II supports Linux boot is on the motherboard.

column331: Server Module management ILOM can be accessed directly via the dedicated DB-9 serial port of the Server Module or via the CMM. Each Server Module includes an on-board separately powered SP that communicates with the four main processors and the rest of the Server Modules. Server Module management is available even when Server Module is powered off but the Chassis is powered on.
column339: I/O is offered in two form factors: PCI Express ExpressModules EM and PCI Express Network Express Modules NEM. Each Sun Blade X6450 has four, PCI Express links allocated to: Two EMs X8and Two NEMs X4. Each NEM has one link assigned to each server module. All server modules share the NEM. For example, Blade 0 has access to NEM 0/slot 0, and NEM 1/slot 0. Blade 1 to NEM 0/slot 1 and NEM 1/slot 1, etc. EM slots are not shared between server modules. Each EM slot is specific to one server module.
column351: 4 DIMM slots per processor, for a maximum total of 16 slots. DIMMs are configured in 2 DIMM pairs. Memory DIMMs must be installed in identical pairs from the same manufacturer and in the same capacity for 128-bit ECC and maximum performance. 1GB DIMMs minimum configuration of 8GB, maximum configuration of 16GB. 2GB DIMMs minimum configuration of 16GB, maximum configuration of 32GB. 4GB DIMMs minimum configuration of 32GB, maximum configuration of 64GB.

column330: Integrated Lights Out Management ILOM 1.1 with RKVMS Remote Keyboard Video Mouse is pre-installed on the CMM Chassis Monitoring Module and the SP Service Processor. ILOM will run on standby power. Note: Accessing ILOM through Mozilla will require Mozilla version 1.7.5 or greater. Support for Sun N1 System Manager 1.3.1. Compatibility for third-party SNMP system managers with requirements for SNMP v1, v2C, v3 and IPMI 2.0. System management is consistent with Sun Fire X4100 and Sun Fire X4200 servers.
column331: Server Module management ILOM can be accessed directly via the dedicated DB-9 serial port located on the front of the Server Module or via the CMM. Each Server Module includes an on-board separately powered SP that communicates with the four main processors and the rest of the Server Modules. Server Module management is available even when Server Module is powered off but the Chassis is powered on.

column339: I/O is offered in two form factors: PCI Express ExpressModules EM and PCI Express Network Express Modules NEM. Each Sun Blade X8450 has four, PCI Express links allocated to: Two EMs X8and Two NEMs X4. Each NEM has one link assigned to each server module. All server modules share the NEM. For example, Blade 0 has access to NEM 0/slot 0, and NEM 1/slot 0. Blade 1 to NEM 0/slot 1 and NEM 1/slot 1, etc. EM slots are not shared between server modules. Each EM slot is specific to one server module.

column35: 1These specification s refer to a system that is fully extended from the rack for service. When in normal operation, there are no side clearance requirements for the server as the air flow is from the front to rear. However, make sure that any front or back cabinet doors are 63% open to allow adequate airflow. This can be accomplished by removing the doors, or ensuring that the doors have a perforated pattern that provides a 63% open area. See Site Planning Guide for Entry-Level Servers 816-1613 for more details.

column16: The Sun Fire 3800-6800 server family can be configured with N4 redundant DC bulk power supplies, which are hot swappable. The DC bulk power supplies provide power for all of the Sun Fire 3800-6800 systems internal requirements, on a load-shared 48VDC power bus. The base package comes with 6 power supplies.

column163: The Sun Fire V20z server can be mounted in industry standard 19-inch equipment racks. The new Compute Grid rack system base and Sun Fire V20z compute servers will enable the installation of 32 1U units in the Sun Rack 1000-38. The optional slide rail kit X9267A, backward-compatible with X9274A is designed to enable Sun Fire V20z servers to be racked in a Sun Rack 1000-38 also known as Sun Rack 1038 and third party EIA 310D compliant racks which have mounting depths of 27-30 inches. Please note that not all third party racks meet these parameters. The slides are usable on racks with a rail-to-rail spacing of 26.88-30.63 inches. The Sun Rack 1038 rail spacing, for example, is 27.00 inches. The slide kit will include hardware that enables mounting to any of the following types of rack rails: 6 mm threaded holes #10-32 threaded holes #10 clearance holes The optional slide rail kit X9267A is a 4-point mounted slide rail kit only. No other kits will be available to allow 2-point, front-mount, nor mid-mount configuration.

column13: 8 PCI slots 4 PCI-E slots/4 PCI-X slots NOTE: One of the short PCI-X slots may be occupied by a disk drive controller. New standard configurations with an integrated controller installed into the disk backplane are available, thereby making the previously occupied short PCI-X slot available. All systems that initially shipped with the PCI-X based disk controller can be upgraded in the field by ordering the FRU part F501-7244 - PCIe SAS-SATA Controller Board. The use of this controller will require the redefinition of the boot path as it is PCIe based, not PCI-X. It is encouraged that Services be contacted for the installation.

Secure remote access via Web-GUI interface over SSL. DMTF-style Command Line Interface over Serial or SSH 2.0. Authentication via Local, RADIUS, LDAP, or Active Directory. column80: Two 10/100Base-T Ethernet port connections via midplane to the Chassis Monitoring Module CMM. Only one connection NET 0 is used.
column169: I/O is offered in two form factors: PCI Express ExpressModules EM and PCI Express Network Express Modules NEM. Each Sun Netra T6340 has four, x8 lane PCI Express links allocated to: Two EMsand Two NEMs. Each NEM has one link assigned to each server module. All server modules share the NEM. For example, Blade 0 has access to NEM 0/slot 0, and NEM 1/slot 0. Blade 1 to NEM 0/slot 1 and NEM 1/slot 1, etc. EM slots are not shared between server modules. Each EM slot is specific to one server module.

column200: Patch Readmes and Downloads Boot PROM and LOM Revisions
column202: The SP card is installed with Integrated Lights-Out Manager ILOM software. ILOM can be accessed via a Dongle cable assembly connection to the Universal Connector Port UCP on the front of the Sun Netra T6340. To connect to ILOM using the three connector dongle cable, use the RJ-45 serial connector. The Dongle cable assembly is provided with the Sun Netra 6000. The SP delivers: Direct manageability - same as Oracle rack-mounted servers. Full monitoring of blade by SNMP. Graphical user interface GUI and comprehensive command-line interface CLI emulating Advanced Lights Out Manager ALOM Secure access and control. Full-featured virtual console through remote KVMS feature. Optional Oracle Enterprise Manager, an advanced hardware management enabling discovery, grouping, bare metal provisioning, hardware and OS monitoring, and integrated Oracle VM Server for SPARC management.
column338: Front accessible UCP provides Serial Management connection to ILOM via Dongle cable. Three-Connector Cable Dongle UCP-3 Dual USB 2.0 ports for keyboard, mouse or storage. 15-pin VGA Female connector RJ-45 serial connector used to connect to ILOM
